snippet: The court refused in October to address the issue of what prosecutors need to prove to obtain convictions.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to hear case that revolves around dispute about how prosecutors prove insider trading charges; case involves Bassam Salman, who was accused of trading based on information provided by his future brother-in-law, who worked at Citigroup's health care investment banking group.
lead_paragraph: The court refused in October to address the issue of what prosecutors need to prove to obtain convictions.

headline.main: Supreme Court Will Hear a California Insider Trading Case
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Will Hear a California Insider Trading Case
